result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob Matthew Schneider was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jacob Matthew Schneider was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Jacob Matthew Schneider was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $350.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges by 11-30-2016  or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered any vehicle owned/operated by the defendant to be equipped with the Ignition Interlock Device for 18 months.
Sentence stayed to commence on June 3, 2016 by 5:00 pm.
Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution to the City of West Allis in the amount of $17.50 by 11-30-2016.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges by 11-30-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
No contact with Lois P. or Taresar C.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete a course in anger management.
Obtain a mental health evaluation/treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed and filed.

Defendant Jacob Matthew Schneider in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeds. Negoitiations placed on the record.

AS TO COUNTS  2, 5:   Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#

AS TO COUNTS 1 , 3, 4,  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case calendared for Sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob Matthew Schneider in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Daniel Mitchell is in trial before Judge Brostrom, Branch 6.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob Matthew Schneider in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4 is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob Matthew Schneider in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob Matthew Schneider in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court will appoint counsel at the request of the defendant.  Court appoints attorney Daniel Mitchell, who is present in court and accepts the appointment.  The defendant is ordered to repay the County at the conclusion of this case at the rate of $50.00 per month.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob Matthew Schneider in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/4/16 @ 1:30pm
